dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.cbe.loc.geo.GeographicLocation
dataStructure.description:
A defined place on or near the earth's surface.It is an abstract modeling concept that provides a linking point to other parts of the SID model.It holds attributes common to all Geographic Location subclasses.

This entity is abstract

This entity is optional
dataStructure.label: GeographicLocation

child.name: geometry
child.description:
the two dimensional graphical representation of the Location allowing it to be displayed on a map and to be used for spatial calculations

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: geometry

child.name: accuracy
child.description:
e.g. this GPS measurement is accurate to +-20 metres.tThis attribute allows us to determine when two points close to each other could be the same point. Refer "[OGIS] Abstract Specification, Topic 9: Quality" for details of this complex subject.Quality for details of this complex subject.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: accuracy

child.name: geographicLocationType
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..1

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association GeoLocationIsOfType

This association end is optional
child.label: geographicLocationType
